commitResults.messageTitle: Add ability to mark tasks as done
Add types of tasks (ToDos, Deadlines, Events)
Add more tests and exception handling

commitResults.messageBody:
After program exits, list of tasks is not saved.

By storing the list of tasks in a text file locally on your computer.
Even after the program exits, the bot can recreate the task list from
the text file, when users interact with the bot again.

This is more sensible, as users will not have their task lists wiped,
and will not have to recreate the list again.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add dates and times to chatbot
commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot saves the timing of certain tasks as strings.

The timings are now saved as LocalDate objects.

This allows for more flexibility and ease when we implement future
commands such as showing tasks that occur within a given time period, as
the class LocalDate has a lot of its own built-in fuctionalities.

Main logic was inside the Duke.java.

Closely related code has been extracted out into several classes such as
Command, Ui, TaskList, Parser,...

This allows for cleaner and more readable code, as the Duke.java file
was getting too clustered. Reduces boilerplate code, as well as makes
future implementations easier.

Classes all stored into one folder.

Packaging related classes into packages, helps to prevent naming
conflicts, and makes searching for classes easier and cleaner.

No testing was done currently.

By adding JUnit tests, it allows us to easily add tests in the future,
as well as automate our testing, ensuring public methods/classes are
working as intended.

Currently, users are unable to find a set of tasks in their lengthy task
lists.

Now, by implementing a new command, FindCommand, users can then search
for a specified keyword, and in return receive a set of tasks that match
the keyword.

commitResults.messageTitle: Tweak code to comply with coding standard.
commitResults.messageBody:
Code initially was disorganized and did not follow a set coding
standard.

Following a coding standard allows for better collaboration between
peers, and increases readability of your code.
Allows for your code to be readable by anyone and future you.

Previously, we would have to re-compile and re-run our programs
manually.

Gradle automates the build processes.
